name: John Doe
note: Patient presents with chest pain. Diagnosis: Acute myocardial infarction. Treatment: Aspirin, Nitroglycerin, Beta blocker. Follow-up: Cardiology in 2 weeks.

name: Mary Smith
note: History of cough and fever. Diagnosis: Community-acquired pneumonia. Treatment: Amoxicillin 1g TID for 7 days. Follow-up: Primary care in 1 week.

name: Alice Johnson
note: Complains of severe headache and photophobia. Diagnosis: . Treatment: Sumatriptan PRN. Follow-up: Neurology PRN.

name: Bob Lee
note: Shortness of breath on exertion. Diagnosis: Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD). Treatment: Salbutamol inhaler PRN, Tiotropium once daily. Follow-up: Pulmonology in 1 month.

name: Carlos Reyes
note: Elevated blood glucose on labs. Diagnosis: Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus. Treatment: Metformin 500 mg BID, lifestyle modification. Follow-up: Endocrinology in 6 weeks.

name: Denise Patel
note: Right lower quadrant pain. Diagnosis: Acute appendicitis. Treatment: Laparoscopic appendectomy performed; IV antibiotics. Follow-up: Surgical clinic in 2 weeks.

name: Ethan Brown
note: Progressive memory loss. Diagnosis: Alzheimer disease. Treatment: Donepezil 10 mg nightly. Follow-up: Memory clinic 1 month.

name: Fiona Green
note: Dysmenorrhea and pelvic pain. Diagnosis: Endometriosis (suspected). Treatment: Oral contraceptive pill trial. Follow-up: Gynecology in 6 weeks.

name: George Wu
note: Knee pain after injury. Diagnosis: Osteoarthritis. Treatment: NSAIDs and physiotherapy. Follow-up: Orthopedics PRN.

name: Hannah Kim
note: Anxious mood and insomnia. Diagnosis: Generalized anxiety disorder. Treatment: Sertraline 50 mg daily, CBT referral. Follow-up: Psychiatry in 4 weeks.

name: Ivan Novak
note: Recurrent headaches and hypertension. Diagnosis: Hypertensive urgency. Treatment: Lisinopril 10 mg daily, BP monitoring. Follow-up: Primary care in 2 weeks.

name: Jaya Singh
note: Lower abdominal pain and fever. Diagnosis: Pelvic inflammatory disease. Treatment: Doxycycline and Metronidazole. Follow-up: Gynecology in 1 week.
